item.title: 12 Best Minecraft Clones, Ranked
item.description:
Gaming “clones” are a familiar concept to many players, since a popular formula for a game can easily be reworked and changed enough to release a different but similar game that could garner interest solely from being similar in style to a popular game. This has been a familiar concept in the industry for years and there are few games that receive quite as many clones as Minecraft has managed.

Since being released officially in 2011, Minecraft has managed to become one of the highest-grossing video games of all time, never waning in popularity over that time and generating enough interest to have several spin-off games, endless merchandise, and now even a big-budget movie in development with names like Jason Momoa attached. However, being a beloved game that has to be paid for, there have been quite a number of clone games, particularly free ones that generate interest for their similarities without any costs being directly involved in getting to play.

Updated October 11, 2024, by Chris Harkin: If a day comes when Minecraft is no longer popular, it will truly be a shock. Despite being nearly fifteen years old, the game continues to hold such popularity that it is still able to garner the support of a blockbuster film release. Though the market for Minecraft "clones" may have dried up slightly in the past few years, the lovable sandbox survival game effectively kick-started an entirely new genre of survival gathering games. Whether these games copied more elements than just the focus and graphics or only share a few similarities, Minecraft has had an enormous and unstoppable influence on the gaming industry which will continue to be felt for years to come.

Despite the use of the term "clone," the intent here is to share fun games similar to Minecraft rather than criticize the following titles.

12 Pocket Craft: Survivor Mode

An iOS Limitless World Made Up Of Blocks

  • Release Date : May, 2014
  • Developer : Bunbo Games
  • Platforms : iOS

Pocketcraft took advantage of one of the simplest ideas that could improve the accessibility of Minecraft in earlier days, which was putting it on a mobile phone. Mobile gaming has varied in popularity over the years, but when Pocketcraft was first released, it was a huge deal, and it was highly praised for many of the features being so well transferred across to a mobile game.

The goal was to build shelters and gather materials to stay alive at night, which was when zombies would be released to try and attack the player. The focus was more heavily on survival aspects copied from Minecraft than any of the sandbox aspects which Minecraft is also well-known for championing.

11 Minebuild: Worldcraft Survival

Android's Answer To Survival Sandbox Games

  • Release Date : June 2015
  • Developer : Pixelbox Studio
  • Platforms : Android

Another mobile game that gained popularity due to the great way it transferred some features of Minecraft into a handheld format, Minebuild has one of the closest names to Minecraft out of any similar game, and it focused much more on the sandbox style and crafting as opposed to other Minecraft clones, which more commonly focused on survival and combat aspects.

Minebuild gave players a lot of freedom for a mobile game and was considered one of the better Minecraft clones for mobiles, a format that became less popular after Minecraft itself hit app stores on mobile devices in late 2014. Despite coming out after this, in 2015, Minebuild still gained a sizable following for some features that Minecraft didn’t manage on its initial mobile release.

10 Total Miner

Creative Sandbox Engine & RPG Game All In One

  • Release Date : December 2017
  • Developer : SamplerState Games LLC
  • Platforms : Microsoft Windows

Originally released on the Xbox 360 as a voxel block-building game with all sorts of capabilities, Total Miner has been re-released more recently on Steam for fans of this classic take on sandbox gameplay. Still as simple but fun as ever, Total Miner is the complete package for a "Minecraft Clone."

Although there are some features from Minecraft not included in Total Miner , the experience is similar in a lot of ways. It also includes skill trees and other RPG features which help it stand out from the crowd, and the multiplayer version allows up to 24 players in the same world.

9 FortressCraft Evolved!

Machine-Based Exploration, Survival & Tower Defense

  • Release Date : November 2015
  • Developer : ProjectorGames
  • Platforms : Microsoft Windows, Linux, Xbox 360 & macOS

A very different sort of " Minecraft clone" comes in the form of FortressCraft . This title blends familiar elements like the voxel worlds and crafting with completely different elements, such as tower defense and assembly lines. Players begin on an alien world, where they crash-land, and have just a handful of machines to begin working their way up.

FortressCraft is fascinating. Bringing tower defense gameplay into a game similar to Minecraft is actually a hugely fun idea, and players continue to have a lot of open-world freedom in some truly massive landscapes. This makes for a big departure from the traditional " Minecraft Clone" but retains much of the charm of these world types and of the survival-based gameplay.

8 Cube World

An Exploration-Focused RPG In Voxel World Setting

  • Release Date : July 2, 2013
  • Developer : Picroma
  • Platforms : Microsoft Windows

Cube World is a great representation of what Minecraft would look like if it was a proper RPG. With pixel graphics and a world that looks similarly blocky to the original, Cube World is a fun, brightly-colored take on games like Minecraft which was well-admired on release in 2013, though this was an alpha release, the full one didn’t end up happening until 2019.

Providing a great open world and character creation which helped to set it apart from Minecraft , Cube World focused more on the combat aspects of Minecraft’s charm more than anything else. This allowed them to garner a great amount of support for their beautiful world, filled with overworld castles and underground dungeons where players could battle with all manner of creatures.

7 Minetest

An Ingenious Voxel Game Creation System

  • Release Date : November 2, 2010
  • Developer : Minetest Team
  • Platforms : Microsoft Windows, macOS, FreeBSD, Android

A game that appears to be very similar to Minecraft , but is quite different, is Minetest . This open-source game engine allows players to create their own games, focusing on a voxel style which gives the games an appearance similar to Minecraft .

Minetest has been around about as long as Minecraft itself. Released at a time when the game industry was beginning to open wider, making it easier for indie developers to get started, these simplified graphics becoming popular through Minecraft helped make Minetest a much greater success.

6 CastleMiner Z

Cooperative Block-Based Survival Horror

  • Release Date : November 9, 2011
  • Developer : Digital DNA
  • Platforms : Microsoft Windows, Xbox 360

A game that was in itself a sequel to CastleMiner , and which was popular enough to generate a third game, CastleMiner Z takes place in a world made of blocks where players try to explore, survive, and build structures, giving it a number of similarities to Minecraft .

Players can choose which kind of terrain they are set down in, and then they must survive against zombies that have infested the terrain. This entry was the most well-loved of the three in the CastleMiner franchise, the zombie focus and variety in designs giving it a lot of replayability.

5 Cube Life: Island Survival

Shipwrecked Island Survival In Beautiful Block-Based World

  • Release Date : June 4, 2015
  • Developer : Cypronia
  • Platforms : Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, Android, Xbox One, Microsoft Windows, macOS & Wii U

Another block-based game that immediately looks similar to Minecraft , Cube Life is set on an island, where the player washes up, forcing them to survive in a much more traditional survival game style than Minecraft initially presents.

Originally developed for the Wii U, this game has since been remastered and released on various platforms. Players are able to play in survival, creative, and multiplayer modes, facing off against a variety of bosses across the islands in order to make the islands safe. There are also cannibals that come out at night, giving this sandbox-style game a totally different flavor from Minecraft in several ways.

4 LEGO Worlds

LEGO Bricks Instead Of Blocks & Sandbox Focus

With Minecraft being a world made up of blocks, it already felt halfway to having the look and feel of LEGO games, and the massive franchise took the opportunity to eventually bring out its own sandbox game set in a procedurally-generated world in 2017 with LEGO Worlds .

This game was all about going to different planets and collecting gold bricks before moving on to the next one. There were multiplayer and single-player options, and players got to take part in a series of quests as they continued in their attempts to become master builders. LEGO Worlds was a solid hit for the long-running LEGO franchise, which shook up the style of their games from what fans have come to expect. It also features the unique idea of only really playing as one character in a LEGO game, normally there are loads to play throughout each entry.

3 Starbound

Two-Dimensional Sci-Fi Focused Survival

Though Starbound is similar to Minecraft , it more commonly garners comparisons to Terraria , often cited by fans and critics as being “ Terraria in space” which explains where it fits into the Minecraft clone listing. It is similar to Minecraft , except it is in 2D, but it still features survival and sandbox aspects aplenty, especially with the great modding community.

The wide galaxy setting allows Starbound players a lot of freedom, the game is a little different in style from Minecraft as it features quests as well as allowing players to free roam. The universe is procedurally generated in a similar vein though, and players of Minecraft will surely love this varied setting and slightly altered style.

2 Terraria

The Ultimate, Intricate, 2D Sandbox Survival

The best game that can be considered a Minecraft clone is one that has gathered its own massive and long-standing fan base, Terraria . This 2D version of a survival game that works in a similar vein to Minecraft was released around the same time as Minecraft and has grown and changed ever since, constantly evolving and finding new players to join in the fun in this light-hearted adventure.

Terraria blended Minecraft’s sandbox style with old-school 2D action and adventure games, making for a mixing of styles that has continued to appeal to fans for an extended period of time. While there are several ways in which Terraria works differently, such as a much more intricate crafting system, fans of Minecraft looking for something new will probably love what this game and world have to offer.

1 Dragon Quest Builders 2

Action RPG Sandbox Within A Larger Franchise

A simplified version of the turn-based RPG Dragon Quest franchise, Dragon Quest Builders 2 is a sequel to a similar first game which took the franchise and threw fans of it into a sandbox-style action RPG with a hack-and-slash combat system, making for a number of changes, particularly in artistic style, for the series.

The Dragon Quest games are beloved, and this accessible version, now becoming its own franchise, has garnered a number of comparisons to the style of games like Minecraft . While there is plenty to differentiate them, this does feel as if a more traditional RPG has been mocked up in the style of Minecraft . This is a hugely fun Minecraft clone worth checking out for sure.

item.title: Silent Hill 2 Remake: How to Get the Leftovers Trophy
item.description:
Bloober Team's remake of Silent Hill 2 is extremely faithful to the original, and parts that they have changed have been homaged lovingly through Glimpses of the Past. These Glimpses of the Past provide players with nostalgic looks into the original game, and one specific event will provide players with the Leftovers trophy.

Obtaining every trophy in Silent Hill 2 is no easy task, and with so many missables, it's best that players keep track of their progress. With the Leftovers trophy, players will not only find a fun callback to the original, but they will add another trophy to their Silent Hill 2 collection.

How to Get to Pete's Bowl-O-Rama

The Leftovers trophy requires players to venture to Pete's Bowl-O-Rama.

After completing Blue Creek Apartments and meeting up with Maria, players will have free roam of the West Side of South Vale. After a cutscene in Rosewater Park, players will need to head West up Nathan Avenue , but beware of the Lying Figures that stalk the road. Follow the road until the intersection with Carroll Street , players can look to their left to see Pete's Bowl-O-Rama , which can be entered through the entrance doors.

Where to Find the Pizza in Pete's Bowl-O-Rama

Once inside Pete's Bowl-O-Rama, players will find the save feature, as well as a door that will take them into the main bowling alleys. Players must now head left to reach the leftmost bowling alley , where on the table there will be a box of pizza. Interacting with the pizza box will provide players with both a Glimpse of the Past for progress on their Echoes Trophy, as well as unlock the Leftovers Trophy.

item.title: Silent Hill 2 Remake: How To Open The Garage Door Near Jacks Inn
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where is the Locked Garage Door Located in Silent Hill 2?
  • How to Find the Garage Door Lever in Silent Hill 2
  • What's Inside the Locked Garage Door near Jacks Inn?

Players will stumble upon a locked garage door opposite Jacks Inn right after they exit Rosewater Park with Maria in Silent Hill 2 Remake . The garage door holds several items that players can collect that will prove to be helpful in James' survival.

This is the game's way of rewarding players who go off the beaten path and explore each area thoroughly. Solving these bonus puzzles grants players rewarding resources and special items. Let's check out how to open the locked garage door and get all the goodies it's hiding within.

Where is the Locked Garage Door Located in Silent Hill 2?

After completing the Blue Creek Apartments location, players will head to Rosewater Park and meet with Maria. After exiting Rosewater Park, head left, and players will spot an Andy's Pizza sign board. Head into the compound, and at the end of it, you'll come across a locked garage door with a carjack stuck underneath it.

Once players interact with Jack, they'll find out that it's missing a handle . Now, players need to search for the lever to use on the garage door jack to lift the shutters.

How to Find the Garage Door Lever in Silent Hill 2

To find the lever to use with the garage door jack, players will need to head to the Octantis Fuels area towards the right of Jacks Inn (location marked on the map). So, exit the Andy's Pizza compound and follow the road to the right. It's best that you explore thoroughly on your way for lootable Silent Hill items.

After reaching the Octantis Fuels area, head towards the other side of the fuel pump to find a green car lifted with the jack . Interacting with the jack will grant players the jack's lever. This is one of the easier-to-miss bonus puzzles that players can complete to get helpful resources as a reward. Be careful, as the car dropping will alert monsters nearby. Now, players can return to the locked garage door in Andy's Pizza compound to lift the shutter.

What's Inside the Locked Garage Door near Jacks Inn?

After you return to Andy's Pizza, use the lever to lift the garage door's shutter. James can now crawl into the narrow opening and enter the garage door. Players will be able to find a health drink, syringe, and ammo as resources in the locked garage door.

In a red toolbox, players will be able to find one of the "Strange Photo" collectibles called " Made It! ." If you're keeping up with the collectibles, finding all these strange photos will reward players with the "Pieces of Unarranged" Trophy/achievement.

item.title: Destiny 2 Weekly Reset: New Nightfall, Challenges, and Rewards
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Weekly Nightfall and Modifiers
  • Episode: Revenant Challenges
  • Exotic Mission Rotation
  • Raid and Dungeon Rotation
  • Raid Challenges
  • Ritual Activities: Crucible and Gambit
  • Legacy Activities and Challenges
  • Dares of Eternity Rotation
  • Xur Details
  • Trials of Osiris Map and Weekly Adept Weapon

Updated October 11, 2024: Another week has come for Destiny 2 , which means missions, challenges, and rewards have been reset. After plenty of waiting, the next Episode of Destiny 2 has finally arrived. As players have seen, Revenant adds a whole new story to pursue with the scorn leader Fikrul having resurfaced after obtaining an Echo. With this new power, Fikrul is raising an undead scorn army at the expense of the Elkisni, so the player teams up with Mithrax and Eido once again to put an end to this new threat.

Alongside the new story content, Episode: Revenant also sees plenty of changes coming to the game. As expected, Bungie is tweaking the gameplay sandbox with some major adjustments to Destiny 2 exotic weapons, buffing roaming supers, as well as finally allowing Titan players to really embrace that tank role with some interesting buffs. The popular Onslaught mode is also seeing some new content, which should push players to jump back into that playlist.

As expected, the Destiny 2 weekly reset is also here, bringing with it the usual refreshed content, activities, and rewards for players to chase over the next week. For a complete look at all the new content available for the week of October 8, including Nightfalls, Crucible modes, and challenges, here is everything players need to know.

Weekly Nightfall and Modifiers

Nightfall Strike : The Lightblade

Advanced Modifiers:

  • Champions : Unstoppable and Barrier
  • Hero Modifiers: Extra Shields. Solar and Arc.
  • Galvanized : Combatants have more health and are more difficult to stun.
  • Overcharge : Grenade Launcher and Kinetic Weapons when the player's subclass matches an active Surge element.
  • Threat : Arc
  • Surge : Arc and Stasis

Expert Modifiers:

  • All previous modifiers.
  • Equipment Locked : Unable to change equipment once the mission starts.
  • Randomized Banes : Combatants are granted random Banes.

Master Modifiers:

  • All previous modifiers.
  • Counterfeit : When defeated, combatants can drop explosives disguised as familiar items.
  • Master Modifiers : Locked Loadout, Extra Champions, and Extra Shields.

_______________________________________________________________

  • Nightfall Weapon : Undercurrent (Adept Grenade Launcher)

Episode: Revenant Challenges

Week 1

  • Coming Soon!

Exotic Mission Rotation

Bungie brought back various exotic missions for players to run through to earn new rewards, gear, as well as craftable versions of exotic weapons. Like the Raid and Dungeon rotator, this one changes on a weekly basis.

Featured Exotic Mission : Starcrossed (Wish-Keeper Exotic Combat Bow)

Raid and Dungeon Rotation

Originally introduced during Season 17, Bungie features Raids and Dungeons in a weekly rotation to make them farmable with updated rewards. Starting in Episode: Revenant, Bungie is making 2 of each available from the rotator each week:

  • Featured Raid : Last Wish and Vow of the Disciple
  • Featured Dungeon : The Shattered Throne and Duality

Raid Challenges

  • Salvation's Edge : Scenic Route
  • Deep Stone Crypt : The Core Four
  • Vow of the Disciple : Swift Destruction, Base Information, Defenses Down, Looping Catalyst
  • Vault of Glass : Strangers in Time
  • King's Fall : Gaze Amaze
  • Root of Nightmares : Illuminated Torment
  • Garden of Salvation : A Link to the Chain
  • Last Wish : Which Witch, Summoning Ritual, Keep Out, Forever Fight, Strength of Memory

Ritual Activities: Crucible and Gambit

Players can earn additional rewards through Destiny 2 's Pathfinder system simply by playing and performing certain tasks in ritual activities like Vanguard Strikes, Crucible, and Gambit.

  • Weekly Crucible Modes : Supremacy, Control, Elimination, Rumble
  • Gambit

Legacy Activities and Challenges

Europa

  • Exo Challenge : Simulation: Safeguard
  • Eclipsed Zone : Cadmus Ridge
  • Empire Hunt : Praksis: The Technocrat

Neomuna

  • Incursion Zone : Liming Harbor
  • Campaign Mission : Desperate Measures
  • Partition: Hard Reset

Throne World

  • Weekly Story Mission : The Ritual
  • Altars of Reflection : Weekly activity that players can take on through specifically marked icons within the Throne World. These missions typically involve light puzzle solving as well as battling enemy combatants.

The Moon

  • Trove Guardian: The Hellmouth
  • Wandering Nightmare: Nightmare of Jaxx, Claw of Xivu Arath (Hellmouth)
  • Campaign : In The Deep

Nightmare Rotation:

  • Fanatic (Insanity)
  • Omnigul (Anguish)
  • Skolas (Pride)

Dreaming City

  • The Dreaming City Curse Level : High - The Dark Monastery mission
  • Petra Venj Location : Rheasilvia
  • The Blind Well : Taken enemies - Plague: Inomina
  • Ascendant Challenge : Ouroborea (Aphelion's Rest in The Strand)

Dares of Eternity Rotation

  • Round 1 : Hive
  • Round 2 : Fallen
  • Final Round : Valus Ta'aurc

Xur Details

Xur, the exotic merchant of Destiny 2 , arrives every weekend until reset, giving players a short window to check out what he has in stock. With The Final Shape, Xur has seen a rework of what is on offer. Here's what the merchant has for the weekend of 10/11:

  • Felwinter's Helm (Warlock helmet)
  • Wormhusk Crown (Hunter helmet)
  • Helm of Saint-14 (Titan helmet)
  • Crimson (Hand Cannon)
  • Coldheart (Trace Rifle)
  • Black Talon (Combat Sword)
  • Hawkmoon (Hand Cannon)
  • Wardcliff Coil Catalyst
  • Black Talon Catalyst
  • Essentialism/Stoicism/Solipsism OR Exotic Cipher
  • Exotic Engram
  • Enhancement Prism
  • Glimmer
  • Gambit Engram
  • Enhancement Core
  • Strange Gift (Random Item for 1 Strange Coin)
  • Scathelocke (Kinetic Auto Rifle)
  • Enigma's Draw (Kinetic Sidearm)
  • Catesian Coordinate (Energy Fusion Rifle)
  • Outlast (Energy Pulse Rifle)
  • Falling Guillotine (Heavy Sword)
  • Shattered Cipher (Heavy Machine Gun)
  • Crown-Splitter/Quickfang/Eternity's Edge (Heavy Sword)
  • Strange Weapon Engram
  • Holdfast Armor Set

Make sure to check back every Friday for a comprehensive breakdown of all the new exotic gear and rolls that Xur brings to Destiny 2 .

Trials of Osiris Map and Weekly Adept Weapon

Saint-14 and the Trails of Osiris offer players a high-end PvP activity in exchange for powerful rewards, especially for players who go flawless and earn a trip to the Lighthouse. Similar to most vendors in Destiny 2 , Saint-14 has a reputation system that rewards players for ranking up through playing and completing bounties.

No Trials of Osiris for 10/11. Back on October 18.

  • Map : N/A
  • Weapon : N/A

item.title: New Tomb Raider Remastered Collection Announced
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Tomb Raider 4-6 Remastered will be released on February 14, 2025 for $29.99.
  • The collection will include enhanced versions of The Last Revelation, Chronicles, and The Angel of Darkness.
  • Fans can expect modern control options, a photo mode, new quality-of-life features, full achievement/trophy support, and more.

Aspyr and Crystal Dynamics have announced Tomb Raider 4-6 Remastered , which will include enhanced versions of Tomb Raider: The Last Revelation , Chronicles , and The Angel of Darkness . Like the previous Tomb Raider Remastered trilogy, this new collection promises to bring the classic titles to modern audiences with enhanced graphics and quality-of-life improvements.

Released in 1999, Tomb Raider: The Last Revelation follows the heroine Lara Croft in her fourth adventure as she uncovers the lost tomb of the Egyptian God Set and faces her arch-rival, the archeologist Werner Von Croy. Tomb Raider: Chronicles came out in the following year and focused on the untold adventures of Lara Croft as her close friends reminisce about her past. Tomb Raider: The Angel of Darkness was a divisive entry in the franchise in which Lara is accused of murder and enters a mysterious conspiracy involving ancient artifacts.

Gamers can now pre-order Tomb Raider 4-6 Remastered , which will be available on February 14, 2025, for PS4, PS5, Switch, Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S, and PC. According to Aspis, the collection will feature improved visuals similar to the ones seen in the previous trilogy, along with modern control options, a photo mode, new quality-of-life features, and full achievement/trophy support. While games like The Angel of Darkness are not considered among the best Tomb Raider games, the collection has other less divisive entries and will likely be a good pick for fans who enjoyed the first remaster. The collection is being sold for $30, an adequate price for three classic games if the remaster proves as good as the previous release.

Tomb Raider 4-6 Remastered Collection Release Date and Price

  • February 14, 2025 / $29.99

2024 has been an excellent year for Tomb Raider fans so far. Not only was February's Tomb Raider 1-3 Remastered collection immediately cherished by old-school fans, but Netflix recently released an animated series starring Lara Croft herself. Tomb Raider: The Legend of Lara Croft received generally positive reviews, despite some critics pointing out its somewhat slow start.

The new Tomb Raider remasters are good appetizers while fans await Lara’s next title. Confirmed to be in development by Crystal Dynamics and set to be published by Amazon Games, a new Tomb Raider reboot has been in the works for years. Amazon Games’s head Christoph Hartmann recently confirmed that the next Tomb Raider game is progressing smoothly, which is good news for fans. Unfortunately, the game does not have an official release date yet, so it may still be a way out. More news may potentially be on the way in 2025.
